growing.water: Moderate; consistent moisture needed during early growth, reduce watering as bulbs mature
growing.soil: Loose, well-drained, fertile soil, slightly acidic to neutral pH

planting.whenToPlant: Plant individual cloves in fall (4-6 weeks before ground freezes) or early spring in mild climates
planting.propagation: Plant individual cloves from a garlic bulb

careAndMaintenance.pruning: Remove scapes (flower stalks) from hardneck varieties to encourage larger bulb formation
careAndMaintenance.general: Keep weed-free; mulch helps retain moisture and reduce weeds

harvestingAndUsage.whenToHarvest: When lower leaves turn brown but 5-6 green leaves remain (usually mid-summer)
harvestingAndUsage.howToHarvest: Loosen soil gently and pull bulbs; cure in a dry, airy spot for 2-3 weeks
harvestingAndUsage.preservation: Store cured bulbs in a cool, dry, well-ventilated area; can also be frozen or pickled

ecologicalInfo.pollinators: If left to flower, will attract bees and beneficial insects
ecologicalInfo.wildlifeResistance: Strong scent deters many pests and wildlife
